block.p: OFFICE DEPOT INC., Delray Beach, Fla., said it had received European Union approval to buy a stationery unit from Pinault-Printemps-Redoute, Paris, for about $1 billion in cash to double European sales and regain the lead as the world's largest seller of office supplies.

MAY DEPARTMENT STORES CO., St. Louis, the retailer, and Hearst Corp., said they would jointly market home merchandise under the name House Beautiful, Hearst's 107-year-old consumer magazine, beginning in 2005. Terms were not disclosed.

COOPER TIRE AND RUBBER CO., Findlay, Ohio, said it would shut its four tire factories in the U.S. for all of next week because of a buildup of unsold products.

GEORGIA-PACIFIC CORP., Atlanta, a maker of paper, packaging and building materials, said it had agreed to purchase the Interstate Packaging sheet plant in Albert Lea, Minn., from National Packaging Solutions Group, Raleigh, N.C. Terms were not disclosed.
